author: John Woodrow Cox
title: Two states, two competing futures for voting rights in America
text:
A crowd commemorates the 50th anniversary of Bloody Sunday on March 7, 2015, in Selma, Ala. (Jahi Chikwendiu/The Washington Post) By Katrina vanden Heuvel October 20 at 7:59 AM Follow @KatrinaNation “The Voting Rights Act has been an effective tool in protecting a right that is fundamental to our democracy,” declared a rising congressional leader in 2006 , “and renewing this landmark law will ensure that each and every citizen can continue to exercise their right to vote without the threat of intimidation or harassment.”
Incredibly, that statement of unequivocal support for voting rights came not from a Democrat, but from then-House Majority Leader John Boehner (R-Ohio).
